physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Tall, thin male; poor eye contact; hunched position; blunted affect; speech latency; thought blocking; lack of interpersonal relatedness; conviction of experiencing 'lines' from mouth and genitals; visual hallucination descriptions; talking and laughing to self during meals; rearranging items for up to 3 hours daily.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Initially showed psychotic symptoms and obsessive-compulsive behaviors. After treatment with clozapine, psychotic symptoms improved with notable reduction in hallucinations; however, obsessive-compulsive symptoms persisted and caused significant distress.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Psychotic symptoms in remission; persistent obsessive-compulsive symptoms requiring additional treatment.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: After clozapine treatment, psychotic symptoms significantly improved, but obsessive-compulsive symptoms remained and continued to affect functionality.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Further reduction of obsessive-compulsive symptoms by about 40% with lamotrigine, while psychotic symptoms remained in remission.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: OCD symptoms decreased after initiating lamotrigine, indicating a positive response to adjunctive treatment.
